question_10: Can plants grow in extreme heat?
answer_10: High temperatures speed up the normal living process of plants to a maximum rate at and above 90 degrees F. This means that most plants can take temperatures up to 90 degrees F. fairly well. Anything above thatâ€”the hotter it gets, the more they suffer!
